examples: heat the oil until it just smokes
synonyms: emit smoke; archaicreek "the fire was smoking"

definitions.definition: inhale and exhale the smoke of tobacco or a drug.
examples: Janine was sitting at the kitchen table smoking
synonyms: pull on; Moreinhale; light; informaldrag on

definitions.definition: cure or preserve (meat or fish) by exposure to smoke.
treat (glass) so as to darken it.
examples: the smoked glass of his lenses

definitions.definition: fumigate, cleanse, or purify by exposure to smoke.
subdue (insects, especially bees) by exposing them to smoke.
drive someone or something out of a place by using smoke.
examples: we will fire the roof and smoke him out

definitions.definition: force someone to make something known.
examples: as the press smokes him out on other human rights issues, he will be revealed as a social conservative

definitions.definition: defeat overwhelmingly in a fight or contest.

examples: we baited her and smoked her
